abstract.para: This article lists requirements for deploying &productnameshort;.

section.title: Hardware requirements
section.para: &productnameshort; deployment is supported on the following hardware:

listitem.para: Installing &productnameshort; is supported on hosts with UEFI BIOS only. Hosts with legacy BIOS are not supported.
The maximum number of CPUs supported by software design is 8192.
&productnameshort; requires at least 1 GB RAM. Remember that this is a minimal value for the operating system, the actual memory size depends on the workload.

The minimum hard disk space is 20 GB. However, the qcow2 images require at least 32 GB of hard disk space. When planning the HDD space, consider also the amount of space used by the workloads of your containers.
&x86-64; v2, &aarch64;, &zseries;—z14 and higher, and &power; 9 and higher CPU architectures are supported. How to identify if your CPU is supported is described in .

section.title: Supported CPUs and support status identification
section.para: In general, on &x86-64; the following Intel CPU generations are supported:

listitem.para: Intel Nehalem (released in 2008) and newer high-end CPUs: Intel Core i9, Core Ultra 9, Intel Core i5 and i7 CPUs, and so on.
Intel Silvermont (released in 2013) and newer low-power branded CPUs: Atom, Celeron, Pentium, Core i3/i5/i7 U and Y series, and so on.
AMD Bulldozer (released in 2011) and newer Zen high-end CPUs: FX and Opteron CPU lines, Ryzen, and so on.
AMD Jaguar (released in 2013) and newer low-power CPUs: Athlon, Sempron, A and E series, and so on.
